_header: Take doves dung and honey well ground
_description: Four medical recipes for women’s ailments — in couplets

HunHM64.First Lines:
Take dowis donge and hony well growndeAnd temper hit withe wex a
                    stounde…
HunHM64.Last Lines:
…That is weten if thou mayst fyndeBrome amerette Sange &
                    woodebyne
HunHM64.Note:
Written as prose, with red highlights for initials of each line; the
                    first heading, ‘ffor syke and Sore Pappis’.
HunHM64.Editions:
Hanna,  Ralph,
                        ed.  
             “The Index of Middle English Verse and Huntington Library Collections: A
                Checklist of Addenda.” 
             Publications of the Bibliographical Society of America
         74 (1980): 235-58: 244-6 (excerpts).
